sentences.text: How CEO Pay is Tied to Cimarexs Performance (page 44)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are designed to align performance incentives with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The programs also provide competitive total direct compensation opportunities that retain, and attract when needed, executive talent and link compensation earned to achievement of short- and long-term financial and operational objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation and Governance Committee considers performance in two primary ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarexs operating performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return to shareholders over time, on both an absolute basis and a relative basis compared to other companies in the S&P Oil & Gas Exploration & Production Index and our compensation peer group (see page 34).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Financial and Operating Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In spite of a reduction of exploration and development expenditures of 16% to $734.8 million compared to $877.0 million in 2015, year-over-year average daily production only declined 2% to 963.4 MMcfe per day.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Operations group did an excellent job of optimizing our production and reducing production expense by approximately $67.4 million, or 23%, from $299.4 million in 2015 to $232.0 million in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our production expense per Mcfe of total production declined 20% from $.83 per Mcfe in 2015 to $.66 per Mcfe in 2016, and declined 39% in 2016 compared to 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We incurred no additional debt and had cash on hand of $652.9 million at year-end 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Year-over-year production revenues declined 14% to $1.2 billion as revenues were adversely affected by low realized commodity prices, which also brought about impairments of our oil and gas properties and net losses for each of 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow provided by operating activities of $599.2 million was 13% lower than that of the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our overall estimated reserves were flat after additions, positive and negative revisions, and production.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We added 324.0 Bcfe of proved reserves through extensions and discoveries, primarily in the Mid-
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continent and Permian Basin, where we added 121.6 Bcfe and 198.7 Bcfe, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we had net positive revisions of previous estimates of 19.8 Bcfe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revisions were comprised of an increase of 126.2 Bcfe for net positive performance revisions, an increase of 138.5 Bcfe related to lower operating expenses and a decrease of 244.9 Bcfe for negative revisions due to lower commodity prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock price increased from $89.38 at year-end 2015 to $135.90 at year-end 2016, an increase of 52%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the same period, average stock price performance for the Compensation Peer Group was 51%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxies also may be voted at any adjournments or postponements of the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The mailing address of our principal office is 1700 Lincoln Street, Suite 3700, Denver, Colorado 80203.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are first furnishing the proxy materials to shareholders on March 31, 2017.

sentences.text: PROXY MATERIALS AND VOTING INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive these proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing these materials in connection with the solicitation by the Board of Directors of Cimarex Energy Co., a Delaware corporation, of proxies to be voted at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and at any adjournment or postponement of the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Meeting will take place on May 11, 2017, beginning at 9:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mountain Daylight Time, at the Wells Fargo Center  Denver, Assemble Room (Lower Level 2), 1700 Lincoln Street, Denver, Colorado 80203.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the difference between holding shares as a shareholder of record and as a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with Cimarexs registrar and transfer agent, Continental Stock Transfer & Trust Company, you are considered a shareholder of record with respect to these shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in a brokerage account or bank, broker or other nominee, you are considered the beneficial owner of these shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What shares are included on the proxy card?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record, you will receive only one proxy card for all the shares you hold of record in certificate form and in book-entry form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a Cimarex employee, you will receive a proxy or voting instruction card for all the shares you hold in the Cimarex 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy card will serve as a voting instruction card for the Plan trustee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not specify your voting instructions on the proxy card, the Plan trustee will vote your shares in the same proportion as it votes shares for which it did receive timely instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow sufficient time for voting by the trustee, your voting instructions must be received no later than 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on May 8, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What different methods can I use to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Written Proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders of record can vote by written proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record and receive a notice regarding the availability of proxy materials, you may request a written proxy card by following the instructions included in the notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner, you may request a written proxy card or a voting instruction form from your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Telephone or Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders of record can vote by calling the toll-free telephone number on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please have your proxy card when you call.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voice prompts will direct you on how to vote your shares and will confirm your voting instructions have been recorded properly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders also may vote on the internet by accessing the website noted on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please have your proxy card when you go to the website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with telephone voting, you can confirm your voting instructions have been recorded properly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial owners may vote by telephone or internet if their bank, broker or other nominee makes those methods available, in which case the bank, broker or other nominee will include the instructions with the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if I am a beneficial owner and do not give voting instructions to my broker?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a beneficial owner, in order to ensure your shares are voted in the way you would like, you must provide voting instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee by the deadline provided in the materials you receive from your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide voting instructions to your bank, broker or other nominee, whether your shares can be voted by such person depends on the type of item being considered to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Discretionary Items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The election of Directors, the advisory vote to approve executive compensation, and the advisory vote on frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation are non-discretionary items and may not be voted on by brokers, banks or other nominees who have not received specific voting instructions from beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary Items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as Independent Auditors is a discretionary item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, banks, brokers and other nominees that do not receive voting instructions from beneficial owners may vote on the proposal in their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How are abstentions and broker non-votes counted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of Four Class III Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting in the election of Directors, you will be treated as not having cast a vote and the abstention will not be counted in determining the outcome of the election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are not considered a vote cast under our Bylaws and will have no effect on the outcome of the election of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on the advisory vote to approve executive compensation, you are considered present and entitled to vote, and your shares are considered in the calculation of whether Item 2 received the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effect of an abstention is a vote against Item 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are not considered in the calculation of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote to Approve the Frequency of the Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on the advisory vote to approve the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation, you will be treated as not having cast a vote and the abstention will not be counted in determining whether Item 3 received the affirmative vote of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are not considered in the calculation of a majority of shares present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of Appointment of KPMG as Independent Auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you abstain from voting on the ratification of KPMG
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is householding?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted by the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the 1934 Act), only one copy of this proxy statement is being delivered to shareholders residing at the same address, unless the shareholders have notified Cimarex of their desire to receive multiple copies of the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is known as householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon oral or written request, we promptly will deliver a separate copy of the proxy statement to any shareholder residing at an address to which only one copy was mailed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Direct requests for additional copies for the current year or future years to our Corporate Secretary, Cimarex Energy Co., 1700 Lincoln Street, Suite 3700, Denver, Colorado 80203-4537, telephone (303) 295- 3995 and facsimile (720) 403-9383.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record residing at the same address and currently receiving multiple copies of the proxy statement may contact our registrar and transfer agent, Continental Stock Transfer & Trust Company, by phone at (888) 509-5580 or by mail at 17 Battery Place South, 8  Floor, New York, NY 10004, to request a single copy be mailed in the future.

sentences.text: How can I vote at the Meeting if I am a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner and want to vote your shares at the Meeting, you will need to ask your bank, broker or other nominee to furnish you with a legal proxy, bring the legal proxy with you to the Meeting and hand it in with a signed ballot that will be provided to you at the Meeting.

sentences.text: You will not be able to vote your shares at the Meeting without a legal proxy.

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote your shares in advance, even if you intend to attend the Meeting.

sentences.text: Please note that if you request a legal proxy, any previously executed proxy will be revoked, and your vote will not be counted unless you appear at the Meeting and vote in person or legally appoint another proxy to vote on your behalf.

sentences.text: How do I submit a proposal for action at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proposal to be acted upon at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders will be acted upon only
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the proposal is to be included in the proxy statement, pursuant to Rule 14a-8 under the 1934 Act, the proposal is received by our Corporate Secretary on or before December 1, 2017, and the proposal meets the requirements of the applicable rules of the SEC and the requirements of our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the proposal is not to be included in the proxy statement, pursuant to our bylaws, the proposal is submitted in writing to our Corporate Secretary no earlier than January 11, 2018 and no later than February 12, 2018, and such proposal is, under Delaware General Corporation Law, an appropriate subject for shareholder action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the proposal concerns the nomination of directors, see the procedures in Election of Directors (Item 1)  Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations in the following section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS (ITEM 1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current Board consists of ten Directors, which is the maximum number of Directors permitted by our Certificate of Incorporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is divided into three classes:  Class I, Class II and Class III Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each Annual Meeting, a Class of Directors is elected for a term expiring at the Annual Meeting in the third year following the year of election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Director holds office until his or her successor is elected and qualifies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the four Class III Directors, David A. Hentschel, Thomas E. Jorden, Floyd R. Price and L. Paul Teague, will expire at the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee, at its March 2017 meeting, nominated Messrs. Hentschel, Jorden, and Price and Ms. Vallejo for election as Class III Directors, to serve until the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held in 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If prior to the Annual Meeting a nominee becomes unavailable to serve as a Director, any shares represented by a proxy directing a vote will be voted for the remaining nominees and for any substitute nominee(s) designated by our Board or its Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the mailing of these proxy materials, the Board knows of no reason why any Director nominee would not be available to serve as a Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A nominee is elected if the votes cast for his or her election exceed the votes cast against his or her election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to our majority voting policy, each nominated Director has tendered an irrevocable resignation that is effective upon his or her failure to receive the required vote and the Boards acceptance of such resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee fails to receive more favorable votes than votes cast against him or her, the Nominating Committee will act on an expedited basis following the Annual Meeting to determine whether to recommend that the Board accept the Directors resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee and the Board may consider any factors they deem relevant in deciding whether to accept the Directors resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Director whose resignation is under consideration must abstain from participating in any decision regarding his or her resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will publicly disclose its decision regarding acceptance of his or her resignation within 90 days after the results of the election are certified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the resignation is not accepted, the Director will continue to serve as a Director until his or her successor is elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board accepts the resignation, then the Board will either fill the vacancy in accordance with the Bylaws or decrease the size of the Board in compliance with the Certificate of Incorporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee is responsible for identifying and evaluating nominees for Director and for recommending to the Board a slate of nominees for election at each Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees may be suggested by Directors, members of management, shareholders or a third-party firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Nominating Committee will consider nominees recommended by shareholders, it did not receive any shareholder nominations for the 2017 Annual Meeting prior to the deadline for such nominations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to nominate persons for election as Directors at the 2018 Annual Meeting must submit a timely written notice complying with Cimarexs Bylaws to the Corporate Secretary, Cimarex Energy Co., 1700 Lincoln Street, Suite 3700, Denver, Colorado 80203-4537, facsimile (720) 403- 9383.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, up to 20 shareholders collectively beneficially owning more than 3% of the Companys outstanding shares for at least three consecutive years may nominate up to two candidates for inclusion in the Companys proxy materials by following the procedures set forth in the proxy access provisions in Article III, Section 2A of our Bylaws (the Proxy Access Policy).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be timely, the shareholders written notice for nominees to be considered by the Nominating Committee or proxy access candidate to be included in the proxy statement for the 2018 Annual Meeting must be received between January 11, 2018 and February 12, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, shareholder nominations must comply with the other requirements of Article III, Section 2 or Section 2A, as applicable, of our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its assessment of each potential candidate, the Nominating Committee considers the nominees judgment, integrity, experience, independence, understanding of Cimarexs business or related industries and such other factors that the Nominating Committee determines are pertinent in light of the needs of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee also considers the ability of a nominee to devote the time and effort necessary to fulfill his or her responsibilities to Cimarex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating Committee Charter specifically includes diversity of gender and ethnic background in the list of desirable attributes sought in our Board composition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although all the current Directors have extensive oil and gas experience, either as company executives or attorneys, their experience is with companies with widely different operating strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This diversity and depth of experience benefits our Board in executing its duty of oversight and guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Nominees for Class III Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the Nominating Committee, the Board has nominated David A. Hentschel, Thomas E. Jorden, Floyd R. Price and Frances M. Vallejo for election as Class III Directors to serve until the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held in 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each of Mr. Hentschel, Mr. Price and Ms. Vallejo is independent under the New York Stock Exchange NYSE) corporate governance rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Director nominees other than Ms. Vallejo currently serves on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have no reason to believe that any of the nominees will be unable or unwilling to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the combination of the various qualifications, skills and experiences of the 2017 Director nominees will contribute to an effective and well-functioning Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes that, individually and as a whole, the Director nominees possess the necessary qualifications to provide effective oversight of the business and quality advice and counsel to Cimarex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Included in each Director nominees biography is an assessment of the specific qualifications, attributes, skills and experience of such nominee based on the qualifications described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarex has a combined Chairman of the Board and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarex also has a Lead Director who is chosen annually from our independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following is a summary of the functions of the Chairman of the Board/CEO and the Lead Director, as provided in our Lead Director Charter:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Duties and Responsibilities of Chairman of the Board Duties and Responsibilities of Lead Director Preside over Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preside at all Board meetings at which the Chairman of the Board is not present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Call special meetings of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicit agenda items from non-management Directors, review Board meeting agenda and materials, and provide input to the Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approve agenda for Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Authority to call meetings of non-management Directors and, as appropriate, set the agenda.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preside over shareholder meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preside at all meetings of non-management Directors and at all executive sessions of non-management Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Duties and Responsibilities of Chairman of the Board Duties and Responsibilities of Lead Director Facilitate and participate in formal and informal communications with and among Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Act as Chairman of the Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Liaison between the Chairman and Directors and facilitate communication among full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review shareholder communications directed to Board and take appropriate action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retain outside advisors and consultants who report directly to the Board on Board-wide issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the roles of a combined Chairman/CEO and an independent Lead Director having the duties described above serve the interests of our shareholders because this structure provides an appropriate balance between strategy development and independent oversight of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas Jorden was elected Chief Executive Officer on September 30, 2011 and Chairman of the Board on August 14, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as an executive officer of Cimarex since its formation in 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has considerable knowledge and experience gained through his executive positions with Cimarex and prior industry experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This knowledge and experience allow him to focus the activities of the Board on matters most relevant to the success of Cimarex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board structure is designed to avoid any undue influence by the Chairman of the Board/CEO on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Governance Committee is comprised entirely of independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the Board acts on the Compensation and Governance Committees recommendation for compensation of the Chairman/CEO, it acts without him being present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The substantial experience and background of our independent Directors ensure their active and knowledgeable involvement in Board matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This involvement, and the presence and involvement of our Lead Director, provide the Board with a strong and independent point of view.

sentences.text: Director Independence and Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines require that a majority of our Board of Directors be independent as defined by applicable laws, rules, regulations and listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We comply with the criteria for independence established by the NYSE listing requirements and other governing laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year the Compensation and Governance Committee reviews the independence of our Directors and any related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the basis of this review, the Committee delivers a report to the Board of Directors, and the Board makes independence determinations based on the Committees report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this review, the Board has determined that Hans Helmerich, David Hentschel, Harold Logan, Floyd Price, Monroe Robertson, Lisa Stewart, Michael Sullivan and L. Paul Teague, representing eight of our ten current Directors, are independent of Cimarex and its management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also determined that Frances M. Vallejo, who is nominated to serve as a Class III Director,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is independent of Cimarex and its management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas Jorden and Joseph Albi are not independent because of their employment as CEO and COO of Cimarex, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making these determinations, the Board considered that, in the ordinary course of business, relationships and transactions may occur between Cimarex and entities with which some of our Directors or nominee for Director are or have been affiliated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the Committees review, certain relationships and transactions are not considered to be material transactions that would impair a Directors independence, including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Director is an employee of another company that does business with Cimarex, and our annual sales to or purchases from the other company amount to less than 2% of the annual revenues of the other company and that such sales to or purchases from the other company are part of our ordinary course of business and conducted in the same manner as we obtain services from other companies that provide similar services; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Director is a director (but not an employee) of another company that does business with Cimarex
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hans Helmerich is the Chairman of the Board, and until March 5, 2014 was the CEO, of H&P, a company with which Cimarex engages in ordinary course of business transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During H&Ps fiscal year ended September 30, 2016, Cimarex paid H&P $17.5 million for drilling services in arms length transactions and as part of our ordinary course of business and in the same manner as we obtain services from other companies that provide similar services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate amount of the payment represented 1.08% of H&Ps revenue during that period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Governance Committee reviewed these transactions and concluded:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the transactions are proper and not material when compared to both Cimarexs total drilling costs and H&Ps total revenues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the transactions occur in the ordinary course of business and at arms length;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Board does not review or approve drilling service contracts or arrangements; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) Mr. Helmerichs relationship with H&P does not interfere with his independent judgment as a Director of Cimarex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Stewart is Chairman, President, Chief Executive Officer and Chief Investment Officer of Sheridan Production Partners, a privatelyowned oil and gas operating company she founded in 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016 Cimarex paid certain affiliates of Sheridan oil and gas revenues of $178 thousand and received $73 thousand from certain affiliates of Sheridan for joint interest billings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payments to the affiliates of Sheridan represented 0.02% of Sheridans consolidated revenues for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Cimarex paid the Sheridan affiliates joint interest billings of $5 thousand, and received $399 of oil and gas revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Governance Committee reviewed these transactions and concluded:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the transactions are proper and not material when compared to both Cimarexs total costs and Sheridans revenues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the transactions occur in the ordinary course of business and at arms length;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the Board does not review or approve oil and gas revenue payments or joint interest billings; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) Ms. Stewarts relationship with Sheridan does not interfere with her independent judgment as a Director of Cimarex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has overall responsibility for risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out its responsibility, the Board has requested that the Audit Committee discuss with management and report to the Board with respect to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Processes Cimarex follows to mitigate corporate risks;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guidelines and processes pertaining to financial risk assessment;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Steps management takes to measure, monitor and control financial risk exposures; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: incentives and excessive risk taking.

sentences.text: The Compensation and Governance Committees review covered Cimarexs compensation policies and practices covering executive and non-executive employees to determine whether the policies and practices encourage excessive risk taking by employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees analysis included a review and discussion of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How the compensation pools and individual awards are determined;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum individual award potential (maximum individual incentive to take risk);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum possible cost if awards were paid at maximum levels (maximum cost exposur
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The decision-making and approval process; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The systemic limitations on the ability to take excessive risks in order to influence compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Governance Committee determined that the risks from Cimarexs compensation policies and practices for Cimarex employees are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Cimarex.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent Directors meet in executive session at each regularly scheduled Board meeting.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, four executive sessions were held and all of the independent Directors attended each session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These sessions allow independent Directors to review the CEOs performance and compensation, to discuss issues of importance to Cimarex, including the business and affairs of Cimarex, as well as matters concerning management, without any member of management present.

sentences.text: Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarexs relationships with its shareholders are an important part of our corporate governance profile, and we recognize the value of taking their views into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engagement with shareholders helps us understand the larger context and impact of our operations, learn about expectations for our performance, assess emerging issues that may affect our business or other aspects of our operations, and shape corporate and governance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our commitment to seek and respond to shareholder input on corporate governance topics, we have considered and discussed with investors a wide variety of matters, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our executive compensation program and disclosures, as a result of which we previously made changes in these areas,

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 BUSINESS AND FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE OVERVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a year of great volatility in the oil and gas exploration and production industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The year began with a continuation of low commodity prices that commenced in November 2014 when the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) declined to impose production limits and allowed oil prices to plunge as U.S. and worldwide production far exceeded demand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oil prices were below $30 per barrel in February 2016 when the Compensation and Governance Committee adopted 2016 strategic and tactical goals and objectives to be measured in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Committee focused on goals that would preserve Cimarexs strong balance sheet, core properties and organization during a difficult period for the oil and gas industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These goals and our performance are summarized below under Annual Incentive Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the year progressed, commodity prices increased and stabilized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is through this macroeconomic lense that the Committee considered the following 2016 business and financial performance overview when making compensation decisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015, year-over-year average daily production only declined 2% to 963.4 MMcfe per day.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Operations group did an excellent job of optimizing our production and reducing production expense by approximately $67.4 million, or 23%, from $299.4 million in 2015 to $232.0 million in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our production expense per Mcfe of total production declined 20% from $.83 per Mcfe in 2015 to $.66 per Mcfe in 2016, and declined 39% in 2016 compared to 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We incurred no additional debt and had cash on hand of $652.9 million at year-end 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Year-over-year production revenues declined 14% to $1.2 billion as revenues were adversely affected by low realized commodity prices, which also brought about impairments of our oil and gas properties and net losses for each of 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow provided by operating activities of $599.2 million was 13% lower than that of the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our overall estimated reserves were flat after additions, positive and negative revisions, and production.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We added 324.0 Bcfe of proved reserves through extensions and discoveries, primarily in the Mid-Continent and Permian Basin, where we added 121.6 Bcfe and 198.7 Bcfe, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we had net positive revisions of previous estimates of 19.8 Bcfe.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revisions were comprised of an increase of 126.2 Bcfe for net positive performance revisions, an increase of 138.5 Bcfe related to lower operating expenses and a decrease of 244.9 Bcfe for negative revisions due to lower commodity prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We principally use three elements of executive compensation to carry out the design of our executive compensation program, collectively referred to as Total Direct Compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentive award Reward executives for short-term financial and operational results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual long-term equity award Focus executive efforts on activities and short-term results that lead to long- term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Half of our restricted stock awards vest based on continued employment and the passage of time, which promotes retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remainder of the awards vest based on performance measures tied to relative total shareholder return (TSR), which promotes the long-term interests of our shareholders and aligns executives interests with shareholders interests.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarexs executive compensation program directly links a substantial portion of executive compensation to Cimarexs performance through annual and long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The diagrams below show the mix of the pay elements for the CEO and other NEOs for fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of the CEOs total disclosed 2016 compensation, 93% is at risk and is linked to Cimarexs future performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This consists of 13% annual cash incentive compensation based on 2016 performance and 80% long-term equity incentive compensation that is both service- and performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 average compensation mix for the other NEOs was 89% at risk compensation consisting of 16% annual cash incentive compensation based on 2016 performance and 73% long-term equity incentive compensation that is both service- and performance-based.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This CD&A describes Cimarexs executive compensation program for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use this program to retain, motivate and attract when appropriate) the executives who lead our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This CD&A explains how the Compensation and Governance Committee the Committee) of the Board of Directors made 2016 compensation decisions for our executives, including the following NEOs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas E. Jorden, Chairman of the Board, CEO and President (Principal Executive Officer)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: G. Mark Burford, Vice President and CFO (Principal Financial Officer)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joseph R. Albi, Executive Vice PresidentOperations, COO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stephen P. Bell, Executive Vice PresidentBusiness Development
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John A. Lambuth, Senior Vice PresidentExploration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This CD&A is divided into three sections:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 1 discusses our compensation framework, principal elements of executive compensation, and competitive positioning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 2 discusses 2016 and early 2017 actions related to 2016 executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 3 discusses the role of the Committees independent compensation consultant and management in compensation decisions, post-employment compensation, retirement benefits, perquisites and other compensation related issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SECTION 1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Framework
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our principal business objective is to profitably grow our proved oil and gas reserves and production for the long-term benefit of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary strategy we use to achieve this objective is to reinvest our cash flow from operations at a competitive rate of return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to retain, motivate and attract, when appropriate, the experienced professionals necessary to carry out this strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Design
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our executive compensation program to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align performance incentives with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We align the long-term interests of our executives with the long-term interests of our shareholders by paying a substantial portion of each executives total direct compensation in the form of performance-based equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting of up to half of the NEOs equity awards is dependent upon relative TSR performance, meaning the more our shareholders benefit through shareholder returns compared to our Stock Performance Peer Group, the more our executives benefit through increased vesting of performance-based equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, our Executive Stock Ownership Guidelines encourage executives to have a meaningful ownership stake in Cimarex, further aligning the interests of our shareholders and our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide competitive total direct compensation opportunities that retain, motivate and attract, when needed, executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We compensate our executives at levels that are competitive with equivalent positions at companies with which we may compete for talent as represented by our Compensation Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, when we review base salary, annual ncentive awards, long-term equity awards and total direct compensation, we reference the 50th and 75th percentiles of the Compensation Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual compensation earned by an executive may be outside this range based on the companys performance, the individuals achievements, and industry competition for talented
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Half of our restricted stock awards vest based on continued employment and the passage of time, which promotes retention of executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Link compensation earned to achievement of short-term and long-term financial and operational objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide the opportunity for an annual incentive cash award that is designed to reward executive efforts for achieving company financial and operational objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The portion of our long-term equity incentive awards that vest based on performance measures tied to relative TSR are designed to encourage above average stock price performance, which aligns executives interests with shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Elements of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We principally use three elements of executive compensation to carry out the design of our executive compensation program, collectively referred to as Total Direct Compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Element Purpose       Base salary Retain executive team and, when appropriate, attract other executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentive award Reward executives for short-term financial and operational results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual long-term equity award Focus executive efforts on activities and short-term results that lead to long- term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Half of our restricted stock awards vest based on continued employment and the passage of time, which promotes retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remainder of the awards vest based on performance measures tied to relative TSR, which promotes the long-term interests of our shareholders an aligns executives interests with shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Positioning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In support of our compensation objectives and in order to determine an appropriate total value and mix of pay for executives, we reference the 50th and 75th percentiles of a peer group of companies (Compensation Peer Group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look at our individual NEO and total NEO Total Direct Compensation compared to individual NEO and total NEO Total Direct Compensation of companies in our Compensation Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because not all of our NEO positions are directly comparable to NEO positions of companies in our Compensation Peer Group, we believe that reviewing the aggregate Total Direct Compensation of all NEOs provides an appropriate reference for comparative purposes and allows us to compare our total cost of management for all NEOs to our peers total cost of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Peer Group is comprised of companies in the oil and gas industry with market capitalizations and revenues similar to ours and with whom we compete for executive and other employee talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews companies in the Compensation Peer Group and modifies the group as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 50th and 75th percentiles are reference points only; we do not automatically compensate each executive at these levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several variables, including individual and division performance, time employed in the position, annual company performance and one- and three-year relative stock price performance influence the actual executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, the Committee approved the 2016 Compensation Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies included in the Compensation Peer Group were, at the time of selection, comparable to Cimarex in size and scope of operations, market capitalization and revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These are companies with whom we believe we compete for employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of selection, the March 1, 2016, market capitalization of these companies ranged from $1.2 billion to $20.9 billion and the trailing 12 months revenue as of March 1, 2016 ranged from $900 million to $4.8 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the comparable date and period, Cimarexs market capitalization was $8.1 billion and its revenue was $1.5 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees independent compensation consultant recommended removing three companies from the 2015 Compensation Peer Group due to financial and/or operational considerations, including market capitalization, revenue and debt levels and operational profile and footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These companies were Denbury Resources Inc., with a market capitalization of $400 million and trailing 12 month revenues of $1.2 billion; SM Energy Company with a market capitalization of $600 million and trailing 12 month revenues of $1.6 billion; and Whiting Petroleum Corporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: with a market capitalization of $900 million and trailing 12 month revenues of $2.0 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultant also recommended adding Antero Resources Corporation (Antero) because its financial metrics more closely aligned with those of Cimarex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Antero had a market capitalization of $6.2 billion and trailing 12 month revenues of $4.0 billion at March 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved these recommendations, resulting in the following companies being included in the 2016 Compensation Peer Group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our long-term equity incentive award program, we grant performance-based awards of restricted stock to our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For grants made in December 2016, the performance measure used to determine the number of shares to be delivered upon vesting is Cimarexs relative TSR over the three-year period preceding the December 1, 2019 vesting date when compared to companies in the S&P 500 Oil and Gas Exploration & Production Index (the Stock Performance Peer Group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Stock Performance Peer Group members are companies with which we compete for investors and investment capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that using an index of companies selected by an independent group such as Standard and Poors provides less ability for management to attempt to manipulate relative performance.

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Compensation and Governance Committee adopted 2016 strategic and tactical goals and objectives to be measured in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the Committee approved these goals, commodity prices were still depressed, with oil below $30 per barrel, and the Committee focused on goals that would preserve Cimarexs strong balance sheet, core properties and organization during a difficult period for the oil and gas industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following represents the level of achievement of the 2016 strategic and tactical goals and objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Strategic and Tactical Goals and Objectives Achieve good return on invested capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achievement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were above our threshold for after tax return on invested capital based on internal measurements which consider only discounted future cash flows from proved developed reserves and are fully burdened with land, seismic, personnel costs, and all other non-drilling costs attributed to our exploration program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The returns were very good by historical standards and reflected our ability to reduce costs and innovate our operations throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Returns were also aided by commodity price increases through 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Manage the balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excellent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We preserved the strength of our balance sheet while adapting to a lower cash flow environment in 2016 by reducing exploration and drilling capital by 16% compared to 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We incurred no additional debt and had cash on hand of $653 million at year-end 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continue focus on redefining and implementing cost structure and innovative techniques that maximize effectiveness using less.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Cimarex executive team performed a detailed analysis of the companys cost structure and staffing levels, both in absolute terms and in comparison to our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we confirmed our historical lean overhead, we instituted a voluntary retirement program for certain eligible employees, resulting in a meaningful overhead cost savings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we established a Water Resource Group to engineer cost effective water sourcing and disposal options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This group got fully up to speed in 2016 and the resultant water cost savings for our well stimulation program were significant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Operations group focused on reducing overall company lease operating expense (LOE) and achieved a reduction in LOE of 24% compared to 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continue creative and innovative development of new plays and concepts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excellent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The organization did a remarkable job in well completion optimization and innovation throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We experimented with many aspects of well completion techniques and deployed emerging technologies in order to gain a better understanding of completion effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This work is ongoing and continues to deliver improved well results.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excellent.

sentences.text: Our Operations group did an excellent job of optimizing our production.

sentences.text: In 2016, Cimarex continued to emphasize safety and environmental responsibility at every level of the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety and environmental responsibility have become a central focus of our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Cimarex organization has embraced the philosophy that safe and clean operations are the heart of overall operational excellence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive team reinforces these principles and lives by them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is particularly true with our emphasis on spill reporting and reporting of safety near misses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have encouraged the organization to be forthcoming and transparent in reporting safety near misses and to use these incidents as learning tools to avoid occurrences that are more serious.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, this resulted in an improved safety incident rate and a reduction in spill volumes with most being within lined containment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarex has made great strides in inculcating a culture that is based upon responsibility and commitment to one another, to our vendors, to our communities, and to the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When it comes to safety and the environment, good is never good enough.

sentences.text: Implement fugitive methane emission reporting process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excellent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, Cimarex committed to report full cycle fugitive methane emissions on our website by year-end 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This commitment to fugitive emission disclosure went beyond the reporting currently required under the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) greenhouse gas emission reporting requirements to include all fugitive emissions from source categories within our operated portion of the value chain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These source categories included processing plants, compression facilities, and gathering systems, many of which are not covered by the EPA greenhouse gas reporting requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure accurate reporting, we performed a full and thorough inventory of all equipment at each operated Cimarex facility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This intense effort involved coordination between field, office, and contract employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a part of our fugitive methane disclosure and monitoring, we committed to the establishment of a leak detection and repair
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By year- end, we had completed our analysis of the Cimarex fugitive methane emissions and posted a full disclosure on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will update our reporting annually and are committed to an ongoing program of monitoring and remediation.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term equity incentive award program balances the short-term annual cash incentive program by focusing executive efforts on the activities and short-term results that lead to long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Typically, the Committee grants equity awards of restricted stock to NEOs each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For grants made in December 2016, the number of shares that may be earned is determined by the relative stock price performance of Cimarex when compared to the stock price performance of companies in the S&P 500 Oil and Gas Exploration & Production Index (Stock Performance Peer Group).

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The awards vest on December 1, 2019, based on the Companys relative TSR compared to the Stock Performance Peer Group for the three years ending December 1, 2019, and are subject to a continuous service requirement.

sentences.text: A minimum of 50% of the shares granted and a maximum of 100% of the shares granted may be earned at the end of the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Half of our restricted stock awards vest based on continuous employment and the passage of time, which promotes retention of executives, and the other half of the awards vest based on performance measures tied to relative TSR, which promotes the long-term interests of our shareholders and aligns executives interests with shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the 2014 Equity Incentive Plan does not set a minimum vesting period, the Committee has set a three-year vesting period for restricted stock awards to NEOs since the Committee began making restricted stock awards in 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividends equivalent to those paid on Cimarex common stock are paid on 50% of the shares awarded that are subject to time-based vesting, and dividends applicable to the remainder of the shares awarded are accrued and only paid on the shares earned following calculation of Cimarexs relative stock price performance compared to companies in the Stock Performance Peer Group at the end of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the shares subject to the award have the same voting rights as outstanding shares of Cimarex common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For restricted stock awards made in December 2016, the total number of shares earned is determined by calculating the percentage difference between the average per share closing price for shares of Cimarex and each company in the Stock Performance Peer Group for the 30 trading days preceding December 1, 2016 and the 30 trading days preceding December 1, 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee ranks Cimarex and calculates its relative performance percentile.

sentences.text: Companies that are not in the Stock Performance Peer Group at both the beginning and the end of the performance period are not included in the calculation.

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Consultant and Management in Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has engaged the firm of Longnecker & Associates (Longnecker) as its independent compensation consultant to fulfill the following responsibilities:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advise the Committee on management proposals, as requested;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Undertake special projects at the request of the Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participate in Committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Make recommendations concerning the Compensation Peer Group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review the selected Peer Group and survey data for competitive comparisons; an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide market data and recommendations on NEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has considered the independence factors adopted by the NYSE and has determined that its consultant, Longnecker is independent within the meaning of the NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, as part of its ongoing services to the Committee, one or more representatives of Longnecker attended or participated by teleconference at six of the meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Longnecker provided the following services in 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed and provided input on the CD&A in the 2016 proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attended the February 22, 2016 Compensation and Governance Committee meeting and consulted with the Committee on annual cash incentive awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attended the May 12, 2016 Compensation and Governance Committee meeting and consulted with the Committee on executive base salary levels;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Made recommendations concerning the Compensation Peer Group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conducted a market analysis of Board compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provided an executive compensation analysis and a recommended range for long-term equity grants and participated in the December 8, 2016 Compensation and Governance Committee meeting and consulted with the Committee on performance share awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total amount of fees paid to Longnecker for 2016 services to the Committee was $127,500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee reimburses Longnecker for reasonable travel and business expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and President is the principal management resource for compensation recommendations to the Committee with respect to he other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) provides an annual assessment of Cimarexs overall financial and operational performance, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ii) subjectively evaluates individual NEO performance and recommends individual base salary adjustments, annual cash incentive awards, and long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His subjective evaluations generally include factors such as scope of responsibility, contribution to Company performance, technical competence, managerial skills and advancement potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: considers the CEOs recommendations in making decisions regarding executive compensation.

sentences.text: Other Compensation Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Employment and Employment Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees, including the NEOs, are covered by the Cimarex Change in Control Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan provides for a double trigger so that payments are made only if
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) there is a change in control (as defined in the Plan) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) an employee is terminated for any reason other than cause (as defined in the Plan) within two years following a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that both of the above contingencies are satisfied, the employee is entitled to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) cash severance payments of two times annual salary and average cash incentive award,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a pro-rata portion of annual cash incentive bonus for the current year, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) continued medical, dental, disability and life insurance benefits for two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Potential Payments Upon Change in Control or Termination for a more detailed description of these benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the 2014 Equity Incentive Plan and the terms of employee equity award agreements provide for acceleration of vesting of outstanding equity awards upon the occurrence of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarex assumed the change in control provisions from the now-expired employment agreements between each of Messrs. Albi, Bell, and Jorden and a predecessor company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assumed portion of each agreement provides that if the executive is terminated without cause within two years following a change in control event (as defined in the agreement), the executive is entitled to a lump- sum payment equal to two times the executives base salary at the time of the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits payable under these agreements are forfeited if the executive receives benefits under any other change in control plan, including Cimarexs Change in Control Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a practical matter, the change in control benefits assumed under the employment agreements only benefit these executives if the Change in Control Severance Plan described above has been terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Change in Control Severance Plan provides for greater benefits payable upon the occurrence of a change in control event than those payable under the assumed agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees, including the NEOs, are eligible to participate in the Cimarex 401(k) defined contribution retirement plan (401(k) Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cimarex matches dollar-for-dollar employee contributions to the 401(k) Plan up to 7% of the employees cash compensation, subject to limits imposed by the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is authorized to make profit-sharing contributions under the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Board determined that no profit-sharing contribution would be made due to the Companys loss in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, eligible participants, including the NEOs, may participate in the Supplemental Savings Plan, which is a non-qualified deferred compensation plan that permits participants to make contributions (and to receive matching contributions) in excess of the Internal Revenue Code limitations for 401(k) plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Compensation Tables, 2016 Nonqualified Deferred Compensation for information about contributions to the Supplemental Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee administers this plan and designates who may participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are paid upon the later to occur of termination of employment or the time elected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a change in control, each participant receives a lump sum cash payment of the amount allocated to his or her account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer a limited number of perquisites (personal benefits) to our NEOs that are not offered to other employees, including financial and estate planning and annual medical examinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate aircraft is generally not available for personal use by any employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the authorization of our CEO, however, the corporate aircraft may be used by an employee or a member of his/her family for medical purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incremental cost for non-business use of our corporate aircraft, if any, is disclosed in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the Standard Industry Fare Level tables published by the Internal Revenue Service to determine the amount of compensation income that is imputed to the employee for tax purposes for personal use of corporate aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There was no non-business use of our corporate aircraft during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Pay Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers Total Direct Compensation at the time it makes a decision on any element of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviews the relationship of the CEOs total compensation to the total compensation of each of the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership and Holding Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines require that each independent Director own Cimarex stock in an amount equal to three times his or her annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, pursuant to a revision made in December 2016, the CEO is expected to own Cimarex shares in an amount equal to six times his annual base salary, and each executive officer who reports to the CEO is expected to own stock in an amount equal to three times his or her annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A newly elected Director or a newly appointed executive officer has three years from the date of his or her initial election or appointment to comply with the Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until the stock ownership guidelines are met, an executive officer or director may not sell any Cimarex stock acquired through equity grants except to pay income taxes upon the vesting of awards or to pay the exercise price and related income taxes upon the exercise of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock, restricted stock units, deferred compensation units and performance awards are counted in calculating ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares subject to options are not counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the independent Directors, the CEO and the other NEOs comply with these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a clawback policy providing that, in the event of an accounting restatement due to material noncompliance with financial reporting requirements under the U.S. federal securities laws, the Committee has the right to use reasonable efforts to recover from any of our current or former executive officers incentive-based compensation related to the restatement and received during the three-year period preceding any such accounting restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy applies to incentive-based compensation granted on or after June 1, 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This clawback policy will be interpreted in the best judgment of the Committee in a manner consistent with any applicable rules or regulations adopted by the SEC or the NYSE as contemplated by the Dodd-Frank Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Hedging and Non-Pledging Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our insider trading policy prohibits Directors, officers and designated employees from engaging in hedging or monetization transactions, and other employees are strongly discouraged from engaging in such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any other employee wishing to enter into such an arrangement must first submit the proposed transaction for approval by the compliance officer designated in the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also prohibits Directors, officers and employees from holding Cimarex stock in a margin account or pledging Cimarex stock as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Law Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the impact of applicable tax laws with respect to executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, (Section 162(m)) limits the amount of compensation that Cimarex may deduct on its federal income tax return for compensation paid to certain executive officers to no more than $1 million per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are exceptions to the $1 million limitation for performance-based compensation meeting certain requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based portion of our restricted stock awards are the only element of executive compensation designed to qualify for the performance-based exception to the $1 million deduction limit, provided additional requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee attempts to preserve the deductibility of compensation paid to executive officers, but does not limit executive compensation to amounts deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
